H0.text: A reduction in the ozone layer is the most likely effect of releasing carbon dioxide pollution into the atmosphere.

H1.text: A reduction in photosynthesis is the most likely effect of releasing carbon dioxide pollution into the atmosphere.

H2.text: An increase in radioactive wastes is the most likely effect of releasing carbon dioxide pollution into the atmosphere.

H3.text: An increase in the greenhouse effect is the most likely effect of releasing carbon dioxide pollution into the atmosphere.

A4.text: The enhanced greenhouse effect describes the fact that by increasing the concentration of GHGs in the atmosphere (due to human action), the natural greenhouse effect is increased.

A5.text: Increasing the concentration of CO2 tends to reduce the thermal radiation reaching space (OLR), leading to a TOA energy imbalance that leads to warming.
